tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE ProteinHistory (
    protein_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    modification_type VARCHAR(50),
    modification_date DATE,
    modification_description TEXT,
    post_translational_change VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE Modifications (
  modification_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  modification_name VARCHAR(255),
  protein_id INT,
  modification_type VARCHAR(50),
  modification_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE PostTranslationalChanges (
  ptc_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  protein_id INT,
  change_type VARCHAR(50),
  change_description TEXT,
  change_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE protein_history (
    history_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    protein_id INT,
    modification_id INT,
    structure_id INT,
    modification_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE modification_history (
   id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
   modification_id INT,
   modification_date DATE,
   modified_by VARCHAR(255),
   modification_details TEXT
);
CREATE TABLE Modifications ( modification_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, protein_id INTEGER, modification_type VARCHAR(255), modification_location INTEGER, modification_description TEXT );
CREATE TABLE PostTranslationalChanges ( change_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, protein_id INTEGER, change_type VARCHAR(255), change_location INTEGER, change_description TEXT );
CREATE TABLE Proteins ( protein_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, protein_name VARCHAR(255), protein_sequence TEXT );
CREATE TABLE ModificationHistory ( history_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, modification_id INTEGER, modified_by VARCHAR(255), modification_date TIMESTAMP );
CREATE TABLE PTCHistory ( ptchistory_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, change_id INTEGER, changed_by VARCHAR(255), change_date TIMESTAMP );
